titleStmt.title: Nevves from Pembroke and Mongomery, or Oxford Manchesterd by Michael Oldsworth and his Lord, who swore he was chancellour of Oxford, and proved it in a speech made to the new visitours in their new convocation, April 11. 1648. As here it follows word for word and oath for oath.
titleStmt.author: Birkenhead, John, Sir, 1616-1679.

titleStmt.title: Nevves from Pembroke and Mongomery, or Oxford Manchesterd by Michael Oldsworth and his Lord, who swore he was chancellour of Oxford, and proved it in a speech made to the new visitours in their new convocation, April 11. 1648. As here it follows word for word and oath for oath.
titleStmt.author: Birkenhead, John, Sir, 1616-1679.

notesStmt.note: "Wood states that sir John Birkenhead .. wrote this piece, which puts a scurrilous speech in the mouth of the Chancellor of the University. Michael Oldisworth .. was secretary to William and Philip, earls of Pembroke and successively chancellors of the University."--Madan.
" 'Printed at Mongomery,' i.e. Oxford, but really at London."--Madan.
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
